66045bfb83eb08527b49499ae87e71a0 (10:54): just off one pixel, should be flush to the bottom edge
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (10:55): hmm, where do we start
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (10:56): `doctype @ addmin

c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (10:56): addmin, doctype: Take a gander at the fine document type definitions available here: http://www.w3.org/QA/2002/04/valid-dtd-list.html (HTML 4.01 Strict is recommended)
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:56): addmin, one: you're using a WYSIWYG editor (a bad one at that)
029295b11097374f131449523678344b (10:56): how did you know i am using a WYSIWYG editor?
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:57): because Frontpage puts a meta tag in it
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (10:57): <meta name="GENERATOR" content="Microsoft FrontPage 4.0">
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:57): your "Main site" has been hacked
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:57): as i anticipate all of your sites will be, use OpenBSD instead
66045bfb83eb08527b49499ae87e71a0 (10:57): ok it is valid now

fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:58): 1 remote hole in the default install (which includes apache 1.3) in the last 6? years
029295b11097374f131449523678344b (10:58): are you threatening the klan?
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:58): addmin, have i said anything threatening at all?
66045bfb83eb08527b49499ae87e71a0 (10:58): I have it position: absolute; bottom:0
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (10:59): i was merely saying that if your site has been hacked before, it will probably get hacked again, and offering a way to ensure it doesn't
66045bfb83eb08527b49499ae87e71a0 (10:59): but it is 1 px off
029295b11097374f131449523678344b (10:59): as i anticipate all of your sites will be

167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:17): how can i restrict the amount of a text a user can type in?
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (11:18): Maticode, usually length, it's in the HTML
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (11:18): or maxsize
fd5e8a8e954db2ff17fdf1deff4857a2 (11:18): `html input
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (11:18): html input: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#edef-INPUT
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:19): thanks brother
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:20): what is a good maxlength for a password?
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:22): `html textarea
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (11:22): html textarea: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#edef-TEXTAREA
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:23): crap textareas don't have a maxlength
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (11:25): Maticode: some simple js will fix that if that's ok
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:28): where can i find that
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (11:29): Maticode: http://psacake.com/web/js.asp
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:29): thanks dude
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:29): know anything else i should worry about?
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:29): right now i have the database with limits and the form elements with limits
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:30): i am going to add captchas for repeated inputs
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:30): this sounds like the sort of stuff that's all taken care of for you in Django :P
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:30): what is Django?
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:31): also, when do i need columns around values?
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:31): as it is annoying
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:31): i mean "" around attributes values
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:33): Django is a web application framework
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): oh
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): i bet it is cool
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:34): Maticode: it never hurts to use quotes, it can hurt to omit them... so, ALWAYS quote your attributes
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): i hate using stuff though
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): ok FunkyBob thanks for the tip
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:34): Django is cool, yes...
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): i like  to know what is going on in complete
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): that is why i write everything from scratch
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): but when i do a rewrite i usually do it difference because i now know what i need and don't need
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:34): i always write twice
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:36): yeah, I can accept that
4323f9537f16ad5aef3d52aeedd3597f (11:36): django is very loose... use what you want, etc...
167a3f9ad43df7edf62bcfe6543a1bc4 (11:37): cool i'll look into that before i start writing 2.0
